meanings.definition: To unwind or unfurl by rolling upwards.
meanings.sent1: I watched the caterpillar uproll from the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The flag started to uproll in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the ribbon uproll into a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to uproll from deep within her.
meanings.sent5: The scroll began to uproll, revealing the ancient writing.

meanings.definition: To move or rise in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon slowly began to uproll into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The smoke from the chimney uprolled towards the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The excited puppy uprolled onto its hind legs to beg for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to uproll through the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the crowd uprolled like a wave of sound.

meanings.definition: The act of rolling something upwards.
meanings.sent1: She gave the uproll of the carpet a final smooth to finish the job.
meanings.sent2: The uproll of the hill made it challenging to climb.
meanings.sent3: The uproll of the paper towel was surprisingly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The uproll of the film reel signaled the end of the movie.
meanings.sent5: The uproll of the credits marked the completion of the film.
